meanings.definition: A large, round citrus fruit with a thick, rough skin and sweet, juicy flesh.
meanings.sent1: I picked some shaddocks from the tree.
meanings.sent2: The shaddocks at the market looked ripe and delicious.
meanings.sent3: The kids had a contest to see who could juggle the shaddocks the longest.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as refreshing as the taste of shaddocks on a hot day.
meanings.sent5: The scent of ripe shaddocks filled the kitchen, making my mouth water.

meanings.definition: The tree that produces shaddocks, also known as pomelo or pummelo.
meanings.sent1: Under the shade of the shaddocks tree, we enjoyed a picnic.
meanings.sent2: The shaddocks tree in our backyard bears fruit every year.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel made a nest in the branches of the shaddocks tree.
meanings.sent4: The old shaddocks tree stood tall, its branches reaching for the sky.
meanings.sent5: The leaves of the shaddocks tree rustled in the gentle breeze.
